intro: Bertya opponens, commonly known as the white sand lily, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes orchids, and is characterized by its unique and delicate floral structure. Bertya opponens is often found growing in sandy soils and is a rare species due to its limited distribution and specific environmental requirements.
